metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37920 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Certifi is a curated collection of Root Certificates for validating the trustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the identity of TLS hosts. Certifi prior to version 2023.07.22 recognizes "e-Tugra" root certificates. e-Tugra's root certificates were subject to an investigation prompted by reporting of security issues in their systems. Certifi 2023.07.22 removes root certificates from "e-Tugra" from the root store.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the python-pip package bundles python-certifi binaries when built. After updating python-certifi, a no-change rebuild of python-pip is required. sbeattie> python-certifi in Debian and Ubuntu is patched to use the system CA certificates mdeslaur> While the cacert.pem file is shipped in binary packages, it is not used in any way, the actual application is patched to use the system ca-certificates. There is a Debian bug filed to remove the cert store here: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=947287 seth-arnold> I'm marking this 'ignored', we don't wish to give the impression that this certificate bundle is supported.

criterions.comment: python-certifi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
